section.title: Documents
section.para: Documents Documents are stored in the following three menus according to the document status. By using these menus, you can easily view the status and history of each document, find the documents you want by filtering and searching, resend documents, delete/reject documents that have yet to be completed in the workflow, and edit draft documents.
By using the documents menus, you can store all documents and related activities as well as well as viewing detailed information about the document status and history.

listitem.para:
In progress: Documents
In progress View the list of documents you have created or signed/approved that are incomplete.

Action required: Documents
Action required View the list of documents you have saved as a draft, requested by other members for you to sign or approve, or sent to external recipients but have yet to be signed.

Completed: Documents
Completed View the list of completed documents among the documents created by you.

section.para: Aside from the three document menus, there is another menu for managing documents.

listitem.para: Manage documents: Manage documents View and manage all documents created from a template in which you have been given access permission. By default, the company administrator can view and manage all the documents of all templates in the company.

note.para: The company administrator can view and manage all documents in the company.

figure.title: Location of the Documents Menus and the Manage Documents Menu

section.para: The layout of the three documents menus and the 'Manage documents' menu are laid out almost the same.

note.para: The layout of the documents menus are very similar to each other, but the documents that are displayed differ according to the document status or permission.

section.para: Each documents menu consists of the following five sections.

para.emphasis: Menu and home icons, and document menu name

emphasis.link: Template category combo box, document status filter combo box, and search box

listitem.para: You can view documents by the selected template category and filter documents by document status.
In addition to performing searches using keywords, you can also use advanced methods such as searching by name + contents, document ID, date, and many more.
Up to 20 documents are listed per page and you can view the documents in other pages by clicking the page numbers at the bottom.

The information of each document are provided in columns and contain information such as the document status, name, step, creator, processed date, document date, and document number. You can sort the documents by clicking the column icon (
) and checking the columns displayed in the column check box.
You can also perform actions on a document such as reviewing, previewing, correcting, voiding, resending, and deleting a document.
You can check the documents status and history.
In the 'Document status' tab, you can see what happens to a document in each step of the workflow.
In the 'History' tab, you can see the activities of the document creator and recipients from document creation to completion.

para.emphasis: The column selection icon, document download icon, and delete icon

listitem.para:
Clicking the (
) icon displays the the column types which you can check to select which columns will be displayed in the document list.

Clicking the download icon allows to select the documents in the list you want to download. You can select multiple documents to download at once and choose the file type including the PDF of the completed documents, audit certificate, and CSV of selected fields.
Note that the delete icon is disabled in the three document menus, but is enabled in the 'Manage documents' menu.

note.para: Documents can be deleted only in the 'Manage documents' menu and you can only delete documents in which you have document management permission. The company administrator or the template manager of a template can grant you document management permission for all documents created from a template in 'Manage templates' > 'Template settings' > 'Set permissions' > 'Document management' and selecting the groups/members you want to grant permission. Document management permission can be set for each template. Members with this permission can open, delete, and download (PDF, CSV) the documents created from this template in the 'Manage documents' menu.

section.para: In addition to doing searches using keywords, you can also use advanced methods such as searching by name + contents, document ID, date, and filtering by document status.
You can also search for field values in documents in detail by using a custom filter. As well, by using a custom filter, you can search for documents according to the range of numbers and dates.
The following table describes the filters that can be used for performing searches. However, custom filters can only be used in the 'Manage documents' and 'Completed' menus.

para.emphasis:
Using the custom filter Documents
Using the custom filter

section.para: 1. Select 'Custom Filter' in the Advanced search combo box.
2. Select the field name, field type (keyword, range, or period), and search value.
The default value of the field name is an empty value.
Make sure to manually enter the field name of the document you want to search for.

note.para: 1. Documents may not be searched if you search for a document by entering the field name that does not exist.
2. You cannot enter special characters in the field name(", ', ;, <, >, \).
3. Empty spaces before and after the field name are all removed. For example, “Time off ”  “Time off”

4. When adding or editing a search value, if you enter a duplicate value in the custom filter, then the previously entered field type and field search value will be displayed. For example, when adding a custom filter again while 'years worked' was entered in the custom filter, if you enter 'years worked' in the field name, then the default values are displayed.

section.para: You can choose one of keyword, range, and period for the field type. Keyword is the default.
Note that the input boxes displayed differ according to the field type selected.

listitem.para: Used for searching multiple values by and a comma (,) is used the delimeter. The default value is empty.

When used, it searches for the text entered. In other words, it searches for documents that contain at least one of the two values entered. For example, field name: fruit / field type: keyword / value1: strawberries, apple  searches for documents that contain at least one of 'strawberries' and ' apple'.
Used for searching for values between numbers or dates. E.g. number: 100~200, period: 2019/01/01~2019/06/30.

When used, it searches for values between the min and max. If you only enter the min, then only the values larger than the min value are searched, while if you only enter the max then only the values smaller than the max are searched. E.g. salary: 1000~ , salary: ~5000
Selects the period in the calendar displayed. The default value of the period length is 1 week.
Searches for the date between the start and end date selected.

note.para: 1. You can add multiple custom filters, and can modify/delete the custom filters you added.
2. You cannot add multiple custom filters with duplicate field names.
3. If you modify a predefined custom filter, then the field type and search values are updated with the most recently entered values.

para.emphasis: Displaying search keywords and modifying/deleting them

section.para: 1. The search keyword is added in the form of field name: value.

listitem.para: Keyword: “employment type: permanent, contract”
Range: “years worked: 5~10”
Period “contractperiod_yymmdd: 2018-01-01~2018-12-31”

section.para: 2. Modify the custom filter by selecting a search keyword added. When modifying, the Advanced filter item is changed to "Customer Filter", and the selected filter's field name, field type, and search value are displayed.
3. Added keywords can be deleted by pressing the "X" icon on the right.

section.title: Document status and history
section.para: If you select a document in the document list, you can view the status and history of that document on the right side of the screen.

In the 'Document status' tab, you can see what happens to a document in each step of the workflow. In the 'History' tab, you can see the activities of the document creator and recipients from document creation to completion.

section.title: Deleting documents
section.para: In eformsign, only members with document management permission can delete documents.

1. Click the delete icon (
) on the right side of the document list.
2. Select the document and then click the delete icon.

section.title: Document menu column selection
Creating new documents
section.para: You can create new documents by using uploaded templates.

note.para: Members and groups can only create documents from templates in which they are given template usage permission.

section.para: 1. Go to the 'New document' menu.
2. Click the template you want to create a document from.
3. Create a document and then click the 'Complete' or 'Request' button at the top right corner of the screen.

note.para: Different buttons are displayed at the top right corner of the screen according to the workflow set in the template.

section.title: Send in bulk
section.para:
Documents
Send in bulk You can send multiple documents at once by using the 'Send in bulk' feature. Also, you can preview the documents before sending them to recipients.

note.para: This action requires either one of document management or company administrator permission.

section.para: 1 Go to the 'New document' menu.
2. Click the send in bulk icon of the template you want to create documents from.
3. Enter the values in the columns displayed on the screen.

note.para: Each row contains all the fields of a document. The IDs of components (which are fields in a template) are shown as the name of each column. The last row of the first column (No.) indicates the number of documents to be created.

Tables are filled in a similar way as in Excel. You can double-click on each cell and right-click on the mouse to add or delete columns. The value entered in a cell can be copied, pasted, and dragged to another cell.

section.para: 4. Click the 'Preview' button on the top right corner of the screen to view the documents you created and then click the 'Create' button to send the documents.

note.para: If there is an external process step in a template, then the left area of the table is highlighted in blue. This area is for entering the external recipients’ names, emails, etc. Depending on the external process settings, there can be phone numbers, verification passwords, etc.

tip.para: If there is an input item that is not shown in the ‘Send in bulk’ screen, then the following must be checked.
1. The components that cannot be entered in ‘Send in bulk’: camera, voice, and grouped radio components cannot be used in ‘Send in bulk’.

2. Check whether the components are allowed access in Template settings: Only the components that are checked to be allowed access in the 'Manage items' tab of Template settings(⚙) > Workflow are shown.
